intro: Euclasta graminea, commonly known as the slender euclasta, is a shrub native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological studies in its native habitat. It is not widely cultivated but has been studied for its potential medicinal properties.
